article_title: HEARD ON THE STREET: Securitization in Europe Is Ready for Rehab
article_text:
Time to come in from the cold.

Securitization, or the packaging and selling of debt instruments, has been a dirty word in Europe since the global financial crisis. But policy makers from Yves Mersch at the European Central Bank to Andrew Haldane at the Bank of England are increasingly talking of the need to revive securitization in Europe. That...

article_metadata.author: Richard Barley
article_metadata.article.origheadline: A European Market That Is Ready for Rehab

article_summary:
Securitization, or the packaging and selling of debt instruments, has been a dirty word in Europe since the global financial crisis.
But policy makers from Yves Mersch at the European Central Bank to Andrew Haldane at the Bank of England are increasingly talking of the need to revive securitization in Europe.
Time to come in from the cold.
